sub_title: Director, Amsterdam Law Hub | Consultant, Gates Foundation
summary:
I'm an entrepreneur specialized in human rights, access to justice, development and innovation. I'm a connector, a team builder, and a creative individual, passionate to solve the worlds' biggest justice problems. I thrive in setting up new programmes, organisations and businesses, and I do so through design thinking methods.

I have set up the Amsterdam Law Hub at the Unversity of Amsterdam - an innovation space for co-creation of legal and justice solutions. As the Director I connect and translate academic research and talent at the Law School to impactful businesses and NGOs to improve access to justice. As part of this role I have also designed the award winning elective course Justice Entrepreneurship, which I teach every spring to selected LLM students.

I also founded SEMA - a social enterprise leveraging technology to generate real-time citizen feedback reports about police services, courts, immigration offices and health facilities (a.o.) in East Africa. SEMA was proud to receive the International Anti-Corruption Excellence Award from UNODC and the ROLAC Centre in the category of innovation in 2019. Through SEMA over 250.000 citizens were able to give feedback on public service delivery in Uganda, leading to measurable improvements at 67% of the public offices where our citizen feedback reports were delivered. Although the organisation is fully run by an excellent Ugandan team, I still sit on the board of SEMA and continue to give strategic advice.

As a professional consultant, I advise on ODA development, budgeting and (impact) evaluation for international organisations and social enterprises. 

Although I'm a European, I'm inspired by African culture and I continue to build bridges between Europe and Africa.

awards.description: We have set up the Vrouwenrechtswinkel, supporting hundreds of women in vulnerable positions with free legal advice. We won the Access to Justice Award after our first year of operation.

awards.description: The award is given out in four categories: academic research, youth engagement, innovation and life outstanding achievement. On behalf of SEMA, I received the 2019 award in the innovation category in Kigali, given out by H.E. President Kagame and the Emir of Qatar.

authors.headline: Director, Amsterdam Law Hub | Consultant, Gates Foundation

profile_positions.description:
As the Director of the Amsterdam Law Hub, I'm leading the organisation's programme development, team and key partnerships to grow into a sustainable and impactful centre of excellence in academic legal innovation. I've also developed, and teach, the elective course 'Justice Entrepreneurship' through which LLM students learn how to develop an innovative solution to an urgent justice problem.

For more information visit www.amsterdamlawhub.nl/en
profile_positions.title: Director - Amsterdam Law Hub

profile_positions.description:
The Amsterdam Law Hub is a new space of co-creation for legal and justice solutions. We believe that justice can only flourish when it responds to tomorrow’s biggest problems. In the heart of Amsterdam, we convene a community of legal innovators, researchers, designers, activists and entrepreneurs to solve these problems. We connect top academic talent with business partners and civil society in the legal sector. We are fascinated by societal developments and driven by seeking impactful connections.

As a consultant of the Faculty of Law of the University of Amsterdam I was asked to set up the structure and partnerships for the Law Hub and raise its first financial resources.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Programme Manager

profile_positions.description: For a few days a month, I support the Gates Foundation as an external SEEK consultant on tracking political, policy and societal developments in The Netherlands with regards to international development cooperation.
profile_positions.title: Country Consultant - The Netherlands

profile_positions.description: De NVR vertegenwoordigt, verbindt en versterkt Rechtswinkels in heel Nederland. / We represent and support free legal advice clinics in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Board member & Chair

company.name: SEMA - East Africa public feedback system

profile_positions.description:
SEMA provides ways for citizens to give meaningful feedback to improve public service delivery. We are an award winning social enterprise that gathers citizen feedback data through IoT rating-devices, IVR and in-person interviews at public offices in East Africa to help them measure SDG16.6. To date SEMA has rolled out its services in Uganda at police stations, magistrate courts, public health clinics and municipality offices. Our system has been used by over 200.000 citizens and is procured by 3 different government entities. A Kenya pilot has recently started and we are testing how citizen feedback data can be used to incentivise (local) governments to make measurable public service improvements.

I've set up SEMA as an entity and grew it from an idea to an impactful organisation based in Kampala with 14fte and with over 500.000 EUR raised in investments, grants and procurements. I've been involved with SEMA as a full-time CEO based mostly in Kampala between November 2018 and November 2020. Ever since, I support SEMA one to two days a week with strategic development, research and impact measurement and fundraising.

For more information visit www.talktosema.org
profile_positions.title: Founder & Board member

company.name: Knowledge Platform Security & Rule of Law

profile_positions.company: Knowledge Platform Security & Rule of Law
profile_positions.description: The Knowledge Platform Security & Rule of Law is a vibrant network of experts working on generating, sharing, interrogating and applying evidence in the field of security & rule of law. The Platform’s was set up by the Dutch MFA, in collaboration with Clingendael, IDLO and Saferworld. It's main objective is to improve the learning capacity and knowledge base of its members, specifically decision makers for Security & Rule of Law (SRoL) policy and programs. This role includes overseeing the selection of funding applications for innovative research proposals for an annual 200K EUR Funding scheme.
profile_positions.title: Advisory Committee Member

profile_positions.description:
Various assignments, most recently:
- contracted by The Netherlands Embassy to support the strategic planning, monitoring and evaluation unit of the Justice Law and Order Secretariat at the Ministry of Justice and Constitutional Affairs 
- contracted by Adam Smith International for DFID to support a proposal for the Attorney General's office of the MoJCA to pursue suits for breaches or non-execution of government contracts (anti-corruption cases).
profile_positions.title: Consultant

company.name: HiiL | Hague Institute for Innovation of Law

profile_positions.description:
In my role as a Justice Sector Advisor, my responsibilities expanded from focusing on justice innovation, to including research projects, impact evaluation and setting up hubs in Africa. Among my (co)responsibilities were:

Building the first global accelerator programme in the field of justice innovation
Advising start-ups working on legal- and justice solutions in emerging markets
Selection of- and investment in game changing innovations in the legal field
Growing new justice innovation hubs in Kampala, Nairobi, Rwanda, Accra, Lagos and Kyiv
Leading social impact assessment
Expert (researcher) on justice needs, procedure design and legal innovation
Account managemetn for Ford Foundation, SIDA (Swedisch Development Agency), C&A Foundation, Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Amnesty International.
profile_positions.title: Justice Sector Advisor

profile_positions.description: I started working at HiiL as a Justice Innovation Agent to support the development of the HiiL Accelerator programme, where I supported the development of its incubation programme, the management of start-up portfolios and the organisation of the annual Innovating Justice Forum 2015 and 2016.
profile_positions.title: Justice Innovation Agent

profile_positions.location: Netherlands Institue for the Study of Crime and Law Enforcement & VU
profile_positions.description:
In assignment of the Dutch Ministry of Security and Justice (WODC), I was the lead researcher on the role of victims as users of the criminal justice system with regards to their right to privacy.  Quantitative and qualitative data collection and analysis. Our report and reocmmendations led the Dutch Minister of Justice to announced new policies on protecting victim's data during criminal proceedings as of 2016 (see: https://www.rijksoverheid.nl/actueel/nieuws/2015/12/14/privacy-slachtoffers-beter-beschermd). 

In the summer of 2015 I conducted a qualititive research project on green criminology (food safety and security) for the Law Faculty of the Vrije Universiteit (affiliated with NSCR).
profile_positions.title: Contract Researcher

profile_positions.description: Assisting within the European Office of Global Policy & Advocacy, working on development policy (strategy and advocacy) for Sweden and The Netherlands. As a consultant, I assisted in strategy and preparation for Bill Gates' visit to The Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Consultant / Research Assistant
